qas.question: When was South Korea's constitution created?
Who was elected president of South Korea on July 20, 1948?
What year was the Republic of Korea established?
Who led the Russian Koran Zone of Occupation?
What two groups were excluded from the South Korean political process?

context: The resultant South Korean government promulgated a national political constitution on 17 July <a0_0>1948<a0_0/>, and elected <a1_0>Syngman Rhee<a1_0/> as President on 20 July 1948. The Republic of Korea (South Korea) was established on 15 August <a2_0>1948<a2_0/>. In the Russian Korean Zone of Occupation, the Soviet Union established a Communist North Korean government led by <a3_0>Kim Il-sung<a3_0/>. President Rhee's régime excluded <a4_0>communists and leftists<a4_0/> from southern politics. Disenfranchised, they headed for the hills, to prepare for guerrilla war against the US-sponsored ROK Government.
